alert.note: Alert for Paradox Valley, Lower Dolores River; Uncompahgre Plateau, Dallas Divide (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 14 at 5:22PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of west central Montrose and southern Mesa Counties through 545 PM MDT... At 521 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms 19 miles northwest of Nucla, or 26 miles northeast of La Sal, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, torrential rain, and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. These storms will remain over mainly rural areas of west central Montrose and southern Mesa Counties. This includes Colorado 141 between mile markers 81 and 98. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Paradox Valley, Lower Dolores River; Uncompahgre Plateau, Dallas Divide
